intro: Homalium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered homalium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It produces non-toxic, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
